page.title: 03Churches in Horsted Keynes
page.content: The village population of about 1400 people is well-served by churches. The {Congregational Church}founded in 1906 is less active today, although still licensed. At the{ Mission-on-the-Green chapel a small but enthusiastic band of worshippers meet regularly. The old {Parish Church of St.Giles }(CofE) has a thriving community life.As well as a full range of services and devotional activities there are a number of clubs and associated groups for its congre- gation (aged 0-90+). The church dates from Saxon times.{ St.Stephen's Church (R.C) has grown in numbers and in its range of religious and social activity since it was founded in 1970 as an offspring of St.Paul's,Haywards Heath. It caters for a large area (25 sq.mls) Half the lively membership are from the village. Strong ecumenical links exist between the village churches
